intro: Champereia lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved champereia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Champereia lanceolata is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
